website_summaries.verdict: Great value pack of broadheads that comes with 3 separate tips that fold up.
pros: Very simple and reliable construction with blades that won't fail to deploy and won't break off at high speeds
Blades are sharp for thick animal hides
Secures quickly to a number of different types of hunting arrows
cons: Blades don't fully retract for safe handling

customer_reviews.title: Will NEVER use another broadhead again
customer_reviews.text: i picked these up locally.from dicks sporting goods. after some low life stole my gear from my truck i got a replacement set off amazon. last season i dropped a doe about 30-35 yards from my ground blind. she made it about 15 yards before dropping within eye sight. the blood trail was crazy. very easy to follow, which really wasnt needed because i watched her drop. the wound was pretty wicked sized see attached photo for wound
customer_reviews.author: biohazard

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for a mechanical head.
customer_reviews.text: Nice wide 2 inch cut. Complete pass throughs with high kinetic energy bows leaving massive wound channels and damage.. Always open on contact with game . And no O-rings or rubber bands to worry about. Accurate as my field points. Pretty tough and sturdy broadhead with trocar tip to punch through bone, followed by 3 razor sharp .035 thousands blades that work together to bring down deer sized game.Whitetail Specials are hard to beat Just watch em drop with good shot placement.. Great broadhead!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Devestating broadhead!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I’ve been a Muzzy die hard for 25+ years. As age caught up with my eyes I’ve struggled on some blood trails over the last few years. Looking for a better blood trail, I decided on the whitetail special. The blood, length of trail, and absolute devistation is unlike anything I’ve ever seen. Shooting 419 grains at 293fps. has been a great set up for me. I can not see me ever going back to a 1-3/16” broadhead.
customer_reviews.author: tammy jackson

customer_reviews.title: Quartering away shot deflected. Not good
customer_reviews.text: The first doe I harvested with GR Whitetail was perfect. Broadside double lung pass-through and she dropped quickly. However, the next doe not so lucky. Quartering away shot deflected off ribs creating a non-lethal flesh wound. She was stunned long enough for me to get a second shot to finish the job but this is not acceptable IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I hit 2 deer with these and even my spotter said it was a great shot. Waited and hour, went and found the blood soaked arrow from a complete pass through (shooting 80lbs), but not a drop of blood EITHER TIME. I called in friends and family to help track or find at least 1 drop of blood, but nothing. To add to the bad days and results, the broadheads were broke - the razor's and the spring/housing. Wish I could return broken bloody broadheads because these did not impress me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan N

customer_reviews.title: these are the best on the market
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of broadheads over the years and in my opinion, these are the best on the market. I shoot a Mathews Creed with Beman arrows and with my set-up, these are the most accurate broadheads I've ever shot. They fly exactly like field points. I shot a doe at 20 yards earlier in the season and she only ran about 40 yards before falling over dead. Grim Reaper's motto is "Watch em' Drop" and that's exactly what I did. The damage was brutal and the blood trail was very impressive... I could've tracked her while jogging if need be. I don't plan to ever use another broadhead!
customer_reviews.author: BAS2k3

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: They are very dependable and sturdy. I have shot them into a tree (one on purpose the other not) and had no issues pulling them out and re-using them. I don't suggest using them in a softer target like the bag targets they sell because well, they are a pain in the ass to pull out. Tried once just to see what would happen, wont do that again lol.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: No Way Never Again
customer_reviews.text: Worst, two deer. 1 out of 3 blades deployed then 2 out of 3 deployed. They where well placed shots so I found the deer thank god. My buddy tried them this year opening and closing them as it says and even added lube! He shot an 8pt and 0 yes zer0 blades deployed. He found a bloody arrow but no deer.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Does an amazing job!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using mechanical broadheads for several years. The previous deer that I have hit would always run 80 to 100 yards before dropping. I had a friend recommend these broadheads. They are amazing. The first day out hunting with these I hit a deer at 20 yards. It only went about 10 yards and piled up. They do the job.
customer_reviews.author: countryboyatheart

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It’s all we use. This deer went down at about 10 yards. Gets the job done quick so we can have a freezer full of the best meat out there! Ordering some more now. I’m a woman hunter🥩that loves hunting for fresh venison instead of store bought meat.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Deadly, dependable, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best I’ve used yet. From other mechanical to fixed these beat them all. Used them for years and never had a fail or lost animals. These things generate a gigantic exit. Shot two deer last season, tracked one 15 yards and the other dropped where it stood. With the same broad head. Took down six pigs as well with no trouble not with the same head of course.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Fridley

customer_reviews.title: The best on the market...period.
customer_reviews.text: These things are unreal. Forget about rage 2 blades and make the switch. These grim reaper 3 blade expandables are nasty and leave ridiculous blood trails. Practice heads shoot as the hunting heads do. Ive killed a doe and 8 point this year in PA's bow season and bith didnt go more than 40 yards from where I shot. Once you shoot these you'll never look at another broadhead.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: When you absolutely, positively have to drop them on the spot, except no substitutions.
customer_reviews.text: I have to confess. I keep one arrow in my quiver with a rage hypodermic. If it's a long drag back to the truck and the deer is facing in that direction, I use that one so the deer runs a half mile in that direction. My Grim Reapers drop them on the spot.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: Her lung fell out
customer_reviews.text: I shot a doe with one of these last weekend. She ran 25 yds and dropped within sight of the stand. When I walked up to her I saw that half of her lung was hanging out of the giant exit hole. Broadhead punched straight through a rib on entry, cut another rib in half as it exited, then buried itself in a gravel road but it is completely undamaged. Just had to wash the blood and dirt off, re-sharpen it, and stick it back in the quiver. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: The grim Reaper razor tip
customer_reviews.text: This is the only Brodhead I will only use. Very accurate, I did double shoulder and the Brodhead was stuck in a tree 10 yards behind to a point I could not pull it out. I killed everything I hit with it and all my friends use it now! Definitely worth buying. Also I want to note if you use a bolt that has a bar sticker on it, take it off it will throw your accuracy off, it’s not the Brodhead it’s the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again and again
customer_reviews.text: Best broadheads out on the market. Heavy blood trails and they pile up quickly
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Not very Happy I was really excited to try a mechanical. Tried one a few years ago and it never opened. Well this one turned out the same but worse. Tried the "practice" tip that was included flew great. But with my prior experience of them not opening I wanted to test the actual broadhead on my foam target. First shot it not only didn't open it also broke. Pics included. And for $40 seems like a rip off. I will update when/if I get a response from customer service.
customer_reviews.author: ryan ksobiech

customer_reviews.title: Does not penetrate enough to kill an animal only wound them
customer_reviews.text: The guards stopped it from penetrating a squirrel which, unfortunately, ran and hid to die a slow death after being struck by the arrow.
customer_reviews.author: David McLaren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Greatest In the world. Been shooting them for 10 years and have taken a lot of deer. Everyone of them I watch them drop.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Best broadheads on the market
customer_reviews.text: Great broadheads! They are completely devastating! Dear didn’t make it 30yrds. You really watch them drop. I hit the shoulder in the way out so it bent a blade. Had to buy a new pack. But for what you get in these broadheads the cost is worth it. If you get a decent hit on a dear their is no question that it’ll be a fatal shot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Killed two turkeys in the fall. Did not pass ...
customer_reviews.text: Killed two turkeys in the fall. Did not pass through. Turkeys stopped in tracks. Just waiting for spring turkey now. Ordered 3 more packs for friends. I am still using original ( 2 kill) head. All I did was sharpen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the bes broadheads on the market
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these broadheads. Shot two deer with them this year. Love the fact that there is no shock collar or an online ring that has to be on the blades. Devastating entry and exit wounds. Think outside of rage.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Stoltzfus

customer_reviews.title: They all have pluses and minuses but to take away all other negative factors I would highly recommend these GRs
customer_reviews.text: Well worth it, i have tried everything else to include fixed blades. They all have pluses and minuses but to take away all other negative factors I would highly recommend these GRs. Guaranteed to insure the meat arrives on the table and or keep that once in life the buck on the ground with a distinct and thankfully short blood trail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best on the planet!
customer_reviews.text: Best broadheads on the planet! Always open on contact and opens a huge wound channel! I have never had to track a deer when it zips through the vitals. They always fall within 30 yds.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These broadhead get the job done. Been shooting for several yrs. Love them
customer_reviews.author: josh griner

customer_reviews.title: Be a reaper...
customer_reviews.text: These heads punch through the hide and cut vitals like a knife. The extending blades cut a 2” path through the target creating a quick, humane expiration and an unmistakable trail.
customer_reviews.author: Teresamaj

customer_reviews.title: Failed to break through bone.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate but it failed to penetrate on a small doe shoulder blade. I just want a tougher bone breaking broadhead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go to broad head
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for years.... shoot great and are very durable. Hold up well if you hit bone. I’ve never had any issues with them not opening up. Definitely opens the deer up and makes them bleed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark watts

customer_reviews.title: I used it this past weekend on a big doe ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it this past weekend on a big doe in Ohio with my Wicked Ridge Invader crossbow at 30yds broad side from a trees stand. She ran about 25yd before dropping. The arrow passed thru and lots of blood around impact site but not much of a blood trail. However did not need one. Arrow dug so far into ground though when pulling out 2/3 blades were gone. Anyways got the job done and have two more in the quiver.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny R.

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead.
customer_reviews.text: Great broadhead. The deer that my son shot with one of these only went 25 to 30 yards. There was a great blood trail to follow, not that we needed it. I ordered myself some of these for this hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: leave a good trail and drop em quick
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny..They really smoke the deer, leave a good trail and drop em quick.. My first doe with these this year didn't make 40 feet if that..
customer_reviews.author: Zach T

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead!!!!
customer_reviews.text: First time using an expandable broadhead. I harvested a 275lb whitetail with it. Had a pass through and he went about 40 yards and was done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bow hunter.
customer_reviews.text: I love these use them last year I harvested 3 whitetail and a mule deer with them. I have found my broad heads...
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Kyle Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Devastating Broadheads!
customer_reviews.text: Flies straight and true, just like a feild tip. Would Highly recommend! Leaves a devastating wound and easy to follow blood trail. It was my first ever archery kill and had no problem with recovery. Ran 50 yards and bedded down. Was dead within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael Morris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very effective; rapid kill; very forgiving shot placement with the large diameter.
customer_reviews.author: SAL

customer_reviews.title: #1 Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Only broadheads to use if you want a good, clean kill. Open every time!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Great Mechanical Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Grim Reaper is a true killer. I only use 1 broadhead once! The first year I used them I reused the broadhead multiple times. These new broadhead are not quite as durable ,but I still give them a 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: With good placement your blood trail will be short
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. Deploy perfectly every time. With good placement your blood trail will be short !!
customer_reviews.author: gsp2west

customer_reviews.title: Not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Very good for penetration but bone can bend the tip and blades.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Herd

customer_reviews.title: Looks deadly Come On Deer Season!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is as advertised and yes there are 3. hunting Broadheads and a practice head. The practice head can only be used on a Broadhead target. I haven’t used them yet but can’t wait to see the damage they do on a deer or hog.
customer_reviews.author: G Smit DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: by far the best broad head that I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: by far the best broad head that I have ever used, and I have used a lot of broad heads. I never lost a deer, I shoot these in my bow and crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: benjamin l.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome broad head
customer_reviews.text: Awesome broad head. This year I've shot two does, two bucks and a hog with the Whitetail Special. All fell with in sight running from 30yds to120 yds. Entrance holes look like exit holes from a rifle maybe even larger. I have achieved pass through with every shot but the second buck, which was my fault. I made a bad shot the buck still only went 120yds. I am shooting 416 grain arrows at 278 fps. Highly recommended as long as you have enough KE, if not choose a smaller Grim Reaper.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect design.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for 8 years. Furthest a deer ran was 60 yards. No matter what broadhead you settle on, make sure it's not a Rage.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME PRODUCT!!! Best , most accurate broad head I’ve shot. Very durable and tough love that the product is made in America as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Donato

customer_reviews.title: Great broadheads
customer_reviews.text: Great broadheads. Shot a doe with them and the amount of blood was unreal. My arrow flys straight and true with them also. I have tried several mechanicals, and these seem to be the right ones for me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: Best broadheads!
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for archery season in New England. I only got one good shot and it did well. I was off the mark, which was my fault, and it ended up being a gut shot but it did a massive amount of damage and I found him only a couple hours later. I would swear by them!!
customer_reviews.author: Sivazrmate

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of the Grim Reaper Whitetail specials. I love the product Grim Reaper makes. They perform as advertised and I especially appreciate the fact that they are 100% made and assembled in the United States.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chandler

customer_reviews.title: They work great & don't open early out of my xbow
customer_reviews.text: Three deer last year, two this year so far. They work great & don't open early out of my xbow. They come apart easily for cleaning & blade replacement . Definitely would buy GR again.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Harley

customer_reviews.title: Massive damage, BUT....
customer_reviews.text: The good, When you do hit your target, the damage is massive. The bad, These are one shot broadheads. Whether you hit your target or not, that's your last shot with that blade. The blades are easily chipped, I cannot for the life of me put an edge back on them. You can get replacement blades, but they cost only a couple dollars cheaper than new broadheads so there's really no point in that. For what these cost, I expected a lot more life out of them.
customer_reviews.author: TcsBack

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - perfect name
customer_reviews.text: Amazing - perfect name. This is the only broadhead I will use! Try it once and you will never change.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Entry hole bigger than a 50 cal!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome!!! Shot a doe and they aren’t kidding when they say “watch em drop” she ran 20 yards bleeding from both sides the whole time!
customer_reviews.author: angela m gallogly

customer_reviews.title: Go with the 2 blade
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that I cannot get a pass through with the three blade. Not on any of the 6 deer I shot.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Shoots true. The practice broad head flew exactly like the real thing. No rubber bands to mess with. They penetrate visciously.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: The raeper is the best !
customer_reviews.text: 35 years of killing deer with my bow whitetail special 2-inch is the best broadhead I have used . 5 bucks and 5 very short blood trails. They fly like field points out of my Hoyt w/fingers release.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boardhead
customer_reviews.text: Great item with great potential for the deer hunting season. Looking to put'em down, or watch them drop!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Howard Butler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used these in the US and South Africa . These are hard to beat
customer_reviews.author: Owl Hoot

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blades
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Makes huge holes and less expensive than the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Jershky

customer_reviews.title: Deadly
customer_reviews.text: Killed a doe with a lung shot from a crossbow. She went less than 15 yards and collapsed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam j

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and he loved it. my son is an avid hunter and he requested this item and he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent broadhead and even with multiple shots the broadhead continues to function each and every time. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: fxdwg

customer_reviews.title: I love these broad heads!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny!!! I've been using these for 4 years! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Johnston

customer_reviews.title: If you are a Bow Hunter...this is the broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Review for Hunters only. First three shots with this arrow...35 yard pass through a large doe...42 yard pass through another large doe....54 yard pass through a large 11 point buck. I have never had an arrow...the old style twin razor blades...go straight through with such consistency. The trail to each of the three was shorter than most of the rifle shots I have made in the past. Easily disassembled, cleaned and assembled. I have bought two packages to keep for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Redoubt Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy on description
customer_reviews.text: Great service. Product was accurately depicted and I got exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I love this broadhead!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts a huge hole and leaves a great blood trail. Very sharp and accurate. Hit pretty close to my field points at 40, 50 and 60 yards. Doesn't relly matter when the deer are under 20 yards. Took my first whitetail with these at 39 yards and I saw the deer crash 50 yards away. Cut the heart into 3 pieces, wow!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiijames

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I won't shoot anything else!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Excellent Broad Head! I have never seen a Broadhead that creates this kind of wound channel. If I didn't know better I would swear I was shooting a rifle.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very Accurate, 30, 40, and 50 yards, The Hoyt Spider Thirty loves all the bullseyes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Amazing blood trail
customer_reviews.text: I shot a mule deer at 60 yards with my 70lb bow. Double lung clean pass. Amazing blood trail. Deer was down 100 yards from hit point. Love these blades.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Watch em drop
customer_reviews.text: Grim Reaper says Watch em Drop. Nothing but the truth, 40 yards and BBD! Phenomenal penetration and the ground was painted red. Yet, again they deliver!
customer_reviews.author: Kraig & Kali

customer_reviews.title: ... my fifth yearusing grim reapers hundred grain whitetail specials satisfied 98% the 2% is for the blades the 2% ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth yearusing grim reapers hundred grain whitetail specials satisfied 98% the 2% is for the blades the 2% is for the blades loosen after so many uses hard to tighten them back up
customer_reviews.author: edward comerford

customer_reviews.title: Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: best i have ever used. Ordered these on Tuesday, Received them on Thursday and then killed a deer Thursday night. I have always used mechanical broad heads. Usually the Swacker, the three blade concept on these is devastating. The blood trail was awesome and the deer didn't make it 30 yards before falling dead. within view of my stand. I still like the Swacker I just think these are better.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Mcclung

customer_reviews.title: Good luck and happy hunting
customer_reviews.text: Watch em drop! That's all there is to say about these heads, you do your part in placing the arrow and these heads will make for a very short blood trail. Good luck and happy hunting!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven N.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome broad head!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome broad head. I killed this KY buck last week and he dropped right there in his tracks. I hit the top part of his heart. I could not believe the internal damage this broad head did. On top of that, I had a buck come in and try to fight my buck that was dead.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. N.

customer_reviews.title: I made sure heads were assembled correctly but the blades just don't click closed like the first pack I got
customer_reviews.text: Still not sure, used replacement blades on old reapers after killing 3 deer. Blades broke while shooting a reinhart deer and did not fly straight. Got new heads and they still don't fly straight. Other brand heads are dead on with the same arrows. I made sure heads were assembled correctly but the blades just don't click closed like the first pack I got. Just don't know!!!
customer_reviews.author: walkin hunter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal cutting diameter and not much of a drop over yardage
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: These work great! They leave a nice big hole in the ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great! They leave a nice big hole in the deer. I tried using Rage broadheads and the would always open up when walking around, but not these. These just stay in place all the time until they hit their target and then they open up perfectly! My dad was so impressed with how they work after I took my deer that he bought some for his crossbow and they worked perfect for that also. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great heads devastating wound channel and will blow through bone.
customer_reviews.author: oldgrowth1

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to disassemble and clean
customer_reviews.text: These broad heads work flawlessly. I have already killed 3 deer this year with the same 1 broadhead. They are easy to disassemble and clean. The last deer bent one of the blades. I figure 3 deer with one head is pretty good. They are also more forgiving than the solid heads I have always shot.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Seelbinder

customer_reviews.title: Grim Reaper
customer_reviews.text: Only broadheads well made in my book. If you do not have the energy to push these broadheads go with the 1 3/8 inch cut. I PROMISE they will do just as good. As with any broadhead, to do its job effectively, you need a pass through shot. The smaller cut will help you do this. I happen to pull 80 lbs and arrow moves at 350 fps.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McClure

customer_reviews.title: Pack a punch
customer_reviews.text: I'm a holdout as I've been shooting fixed blade for 16 years. These fly true and hit hard, didn't even need to adjust my sights. Took a buck a few weeks ago in PA archery. 13 yards, clean pass through, double lung. Lots or carnage on the inside, one lung was cut in half. 08 Bowtech General @ 275 fps. Ran 60 yards and piled up. I'm hooked. Picked it up and hosed it off and it's ready to do the job again.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Bollinger

customer_reviews.title: well made and seems sturdy. Yet to shoot anything with it
customer_reviews.text: Looks wicked, well made and seems sturdy. Yet to shoot anything with it.
customer_reviews.author: AlexZ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fly true but blades broke after 10 hits in The Block Target.
customer_reviews.author: D-nice

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 Chance
customer_reviews.text: Shot my first buck and put a nice big hole in him. I was shocked by the size of it. HOWEVER, two weeks later have another buck walk in on me and I had a clean pass threw, watched the buck bleed decent as he ran away when I got my arrow only one arm deployed and it was bent almost to a 90 degree angle with the tip broke off. I will not be using my third one in the package. For fear of another malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hughes

customer_reviews.title: I had my doubts
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts but the broad heads did great I would highly recommend them to anyone who is serious about bow hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Used Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: That is a first I've never bought broadheads that were used and still and still have blood on them
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Blade Opens in Flight
customer_reviews.text: Practice head flew just as field tip. Lost 2 turkeys due to blade opening in flight and sending arrows WAY off course. No response from customer service email and phone call. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Dean Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast and the Grimm Reapers are one of the best mechanical tips on the market. I would recommend this product to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: James P Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shot true and just like fildtipe can wait to go hunting with them
customer_reviews.author: Wayne C.

customer_reviews.title: seller and shipment was good.. product sucks
customer_reviews.text: seller and shipment was good.. product sucks.. put perfect shot on doe first day of season this year, and two the the three blades broke off and one didn't even open.. entrance and exit would where about the size of a quarter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In my book garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I've shot 2 deer with this broad head. Both times the blades did not open. I did kill one buck but that was due to shot placement and one vain did open. In my book garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Aldacar

customer_reviews.title: upset customer
customer_reviews.text: broadheads do not shoot like a field tip and also does not shoot like the practice tip they give you. Its not my bow its the broad heads. Shoot the broad heads at 20 yards before taking them into the woods to see how they shot and they had a 4 inch drop to the right. I thought it was me but after shooting 12 times and hitting the same spot every time i knew there is something wrong with the broad heads. So i shot the practice broadhead and it hit dead center where i was aiming. They will not give me a refund and i am very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy P Procopio
